Title: An Indian Owl, a Stork, and a Heron
Medium: ink and pigments on European laid paper
Description: These illustrations from Walters manuscript W.659 depict an Indian owl (kalik), a stork (laqlaq), and a heron (malik al-hazin).
Keywords: Islamic; Ottoman; Turkish; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Turkey; Cosmology; Astrology; Science -- Medicine
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Zakariya ibn Muhammad Qazwini (ca. 1203-1283)
